relation: A Map with additional variables that are made available during script execution.
Copy the attachments into the 'out' message. Defaults to true.
Copy the properties into the 'out' message. Defaults to true.
Set this flag to true to true to avoid sending back a response message. Defaults to false
Get the qualified name of the endpoint interface.
The scripting language to be used. Defaults to autodetect to determine the language by the script file extension.
The resource bundle to use when logging internationalized messages.
Custom marshaler implementation to handle startup/shutdown, loading the script code and registering additional user beans.
Spring Resource referring to the script location.
Get the service qualified name of the endpoint.
Target endpoint for the output exchange that is created by the script.
Target interface for the output exchange that is created by the script.
Target operation for the output exchange that is created by the script.
Target service for the output exchange that is created by the script.
URI for configuring target service/endpoint/interface for the exchange that is created by the script.
textBeforeTable: Endpoint properties scripting:endpoint scripting:endpoint :: The scripting endpoint can be used to use scripts to handle exchanges or send new exchanges The servicemix-scripting component defines a single endpoint type: Endpoint types </beans> <!-- add scripting:endpoint here --> <beans xmlns:scripting="http://servicemix.apache.org/scripting/1.0">  The namespace URI for the servicemix-bean JBI component is http://servicemix.apache.org/scripting/1.0. This is an example of an xbean.xml file with a namespace definition with prefix bean. Namespace and xbean.xml Rhino JavaScript (1.7R1) JRuby (1.1.2) Groovy (1.5.6) The component is currently shipping with: The ServiceMix Scripting component provides support for processing scripts using JSR-223 compliant scripting languages. Overview servicemix-scripting  JBI 1.0 support is available in Apache ServiceMix 4 to allow existing users to migrate more easily to this latest version - if you're a new user, you should consider JBI deprecated and not use it for your project. Take a look at our technology selection guidelines for more information. JBI Support deprecated in Apache ServiceMix 4 servicemix-xmpp servicemix-wsn2005 servicemix-vfs servicemix-validation servicemix-snmp servicemix-scripting servicemix-saxon servicemix-quartz servicemix-osworkflow servicemix-mail servicemix-jms servicemix-http servicemix-ftp servicemix-file servicemix-exec servicemix-eip servicemix-drools servicemix-cxf-se servicemix-cxf-bc
